page.title: 01Wednesbury,Darlaston,Tipton.
page.content: Definitive{Black Country.}An area which expanded hugely during the {Industrial Revolution}and now shows more of its scars than its benefits. Still considerable evidence of mining subsidence throughout the 4 x 3 Km block and a few holes from 18C & 19C {delving}for coal, limestone and ore. Much of the standing water which has formed in such holes is hard and alkaline. Some of this water has traces of phosphates and man-made fibres and very little, or in some cases no, insect life. Insect life is now returning to the{River Tame,}which has been cleaned up in the last 10yrs. Many of the industrial sites have been demolished very quickly after closure and the area colonised by buttercups and nettles. These areas now show good numbers of Rodents, Sparrows, Martins and Kestrels.
